training_organizations.name: Arizona DCS – Training Unit
training_organizations.description: The Arizona Department of Child Safety’s Training Unit delivers training programs for new CPS case managers and ongoing staff development. It focuses on Arizona’s practice model, legal requirements, and skills like safety assessment and engagement with families.

training_organizations.name: Evident Change (Structured Decision Making)
training_organizations.description: Arizona utilizes the Structured Decision Making (SDM) risk and safety assessment tools developed by Evident Change (formerly NCCD) to guide CPS investigations. This nonprofit provides Arizona with the SDM model, training, and data analysis to improve consistency in assessing child safety and risk:contentReference[oaicite:0]{index=0}.

training_organizations.name: Children’s Action Alliance
training_organizations.description: An Arizona nonprofit advocacy organization that monitors the child welfare system and pushes for improvements. It produces research on Arizona’s CPS performance, advocates for better funding and policies, and works to ensure children in foster care have access to services and a stable foster home.

perpetrator_relationships.relationship: Victim Was Child of Boyfriend or Girlfriend

title_iv_e_foster_care.recipient_name: LUTHERAN SOCIAL SERVICES OF THE SOUTHWEST

policies.TribalFoster: Yes, Tribes within state provide foster care
policies.FatalitiesReview: Yes, reviews are required for all or some cases
policies.Def_Subtype_Abuse: Abuse includes physical abuse, sexual abuse, emotional maltreatment, and unreasonable confinement of a child; Corporal punishment is a subtype of discipline; Permitting a child to enter or remain in any structure or vehicle in which volatile, toxic or flammable chemicals are found, or equipment is possessed by any person for the purpose of manufacturing a dangerous drug is considered abuse if physical injuries are a result
policies.Tribe_IVE_Specify: Navajo Nation, Pascua Yaqui Tribe, Salt River Pima-Maricopa Indian Community
policies.Def_Subtype_Neglect: Neglect includes inadequate food, clothing, shelter, and medical care, prenatal exposure to drugs or substance, fetal alcohol syndrome or fetal alcohol effects, and deliberate exposure to sexual conduct, contact, and explicit materials; Failure to thrive is a subtype of medical neglect; Permitting a child to enter or remain in any structure or vehicle in which volatile, toxic or flammable chemicals are found, or equipment is possessed by any person for the purpose of manufacturing a dangerous drug is neglect if there are no physical injuries as a result
policies.NearFatalitiesReview: Yes, reviews are required for all or some cases
policies.TribalFoster_Specify: Cocopah, Colorado River Indian Tribes, Fort McDowell, Gila River, Hopi, Navajo, Pascua Yaqui tribe, Salt River, San Carlos Apache, White Mountain Apache, Yavapai Apache
policies.TribalReport_Specify: All 22 federally recognized Tribes in Arizona: Ak-Chin Indian Community; Cocopah Indian Tribe; Colorado River Indian Tribes; Fort McDowell Yavapai Nation; Fort Mojave Indian Tribe; Gila River Indian Community; Havasupai Tribe; Hopi Tribe; Hualapai Tribe; Kaibab Band of Paiute Indians; Navajo Nation; Pascua Yaqui Tribe; Pueblo of Zuni; Quechan Indian Tribe; Salt River Pima-Maricopa Indian Community; San Carlos Apache Tribe; San Juan Southern Paiute Tribe; Tohono O'odham Nation; Tonto Apache Tribe; White Mountain Apache Tribe; Yavapai-Apache Nation; Yavapai-Prescott Indian Tribe
policies.Reporter_OtherSpecify: Child safety worker; Parent, stepparent, or guardian of minor; Domestic violence or sexual assault victim advocates; Any other person who has responsibility for the care or treatment of the minor; Any person who is employed as the supervisor or administrator of a person who is a mandated reporter
policies.InvestReq_OtherSpecify: Obtain information from another jurisdiction, where abuse or neglect occurred, concerning the alleged child victim and alleged perpetrator, as needed; Obtain and review criminal histories, court orders, and any additional documents that are known and available that may assist in the assessment of child safety and the investigation of the allegations
policies.InvestQual_OtherSpecify: Case managers must have a Department of Public Safety Level One Fingerprint Clearance Card; Investigative specialists must possess and maintain a current, valid state-issued driver's license and must maintain acceptable driving records; Selected candidates must be able to pass a written exam, background investigation, Motor Vehicle Report check and DCS Central Registry check
policies.ScreenInfo_OtherSpecify: A Department of Child and Safety (DCS) report must include, if available: Any information regarding possible prior abuse or neglect, including reference to any communication or DCS report involving the child, the child's siblings or the person suspected of committing the abuse or neglect
policies.AntiDiscrim_OtherSpecify: Any other characteristic protected by law
policies.DefPerp_VaryByTypeSpecify: For abandonment, the perpetrator is a parent; For all categories of neglect, the perpetrator includes parent, guardian or custodian
policies.ScreenerQual_OtherSpecify: Staff must have a Department of Public Safety Level One Fingerprint Clearance Card. Selected candidates must be able to pass a written exam, background investigation, Motor Vehicle Report check and DCS Central Registry check
policies.InvestQual_TrainingSpecify: Case managers are required to be in training full time during the first 22 weeks of employment
policies.AntiDiscrim_Who_SomeSpecify: Children and youth in foster care
policies.AntiDiscrim_Who_VarySpecify: Children and youth in foster care are covered for gender identity or expression and sexual orientation; All children, youth, and families engaged in the child welfare system are covered for the following characteristics: age, race, disability, religion, national origin, color, and any other characteristic protected by law
policies.CaseManagerQual_OtherSpecify: Case managers must have a Department of Public Safety Level One Fingerprint Clearance Card; Selected candidates must be able to pass a written exam, background investigation, Motor Vehicle Report check and DCS Central Registry check
policies.InvestQual_ExperienceSpecify: Case managers must have a bachelor's or master's degree OR have 4 years of experience as a DCS Case Aide; Investigative specialists must have 2 years of law enforcement, detective, or investigative experience specializing in crimes against children and sex crimes OR 18 months of experience as an Investigative DCS Specialist with AZ Department of Child Safety or any state agency
policies.ReporterPenalty_OtherSpecify: Child safety worker; Parent, stepparent, or guardian of minor; Domestic violence or sexual assault victim advocates; Any other person who has responsibility for the care or treatment of the minor; Any person who is employed as the supervisor or administrator of a person who is a mandated reporter
policies.ScreenerQual_TrainingSpecify: New hires are required to take in-person training every other week during the first 22 weeks of employment
policies.AntiDiscrim_Apply_SomeSpecify: When making decisions about out of-home placements; When making decisions to offer support services to help meet the needs of children and families
policies.AntiDiscrim_Apply_VarySpecify: Gender identity or expression and sexual orientation apply only when making decisions about out-of-home placements and when making decisions to offer support services to help meet the needs of children and families; The following characteristics apply broadly to all decision points or parts of the child welfare system: age, race, disability, religion, national origin, color, and any other characteristic protected by law
policies.AntiDiscrim_Staff_VarySpecify: (1) Age, race, disability, religion, national origin, color, and any other characteristic protected by law are specified for staff from child welfare agency, contracted child welfare provider organizations, foster parents, kinship caregivers, interns, and volunteers; (2) Gender identity or expression and sexual orientation are specified for staff from contracted child welfare organizations and foster parents and kinship caregivers
policies.FatalitiesDefine_OtherSpecify: Injury or condition is consistent with non-accidental injury, and based on the information available to the physician at this time, it is the physician's opinion that the child likely died as a result of this injury or condition
policies.ScreenRiskAssess_OtherSpecify: Hotline Report Decision Tool and Criminal Conduct Screening Guide
policies.CaseManagerQual_ExperienceSpec: Case managers must have a bachelor's or master's degree OR have 4 years of experience as a DCS Case Aide
policies.InvestReq_MedEvalCases_Specify: Head injury resulting in skull fracture; Internal organ injury; Multiple injuries; Severe facial bruises; Fractures or bruises in a non-ambulatory child; Fractures; Instrumentation injury with risk of impairment; Immersion burns; Second and third degree burns; Abusive head trauma; Medical child abuse; Delayed or untreated medical condition which is life threatening or permanently disabling; Serious physical injury or illness due to neglect; Child under age 6 who has been provided prescribed/non-prescribed or illegal drugs or alcohol and is exhibiting symptoms of the drug or alcohol; Child reporting vaginal or anal penetration or oral sexual contact within the past 72 hours, AND has not been examined by a medical doctor; or child reporting sexual abuse within the past 120 hours, AND has not been examined by a medical doctor
policies.ScreenerQual_ExperienceSpecify: Staff must have a bachelor's or master's degree OR have 4 years of experience as a DCS Case Aide
policies.CaseManagerQual_TrainingSpecify: New hires are required to take in-person training every other week during the first 22 weeks of employment
